tag.name: @jrun.always-dirty
tag.doc: The always-dirty element can be used to force synchronization with the data source at the ends of transactions even when there has been no change to the entity bean's fields

tag.name: @jrun.cluster-home
tag.doc: The cluster-home element denotes whether the EJBHome should be clustered for this bean. If clustering is enabled in jrun.xml, this value is true by default. You can use this element to override this behavior on a bean-by-bean basis

tag.name: @jrun.cluster-object
tag.doc: The cluster-object element denotes whether the EJBObject should be clustered for this bean. If clustering is enabled in jrun.xml, this value is true by default. You can use this element to override this behavior on a bean-by-bean basis

tag.name: @jrun.commit-option
tag.doc: The commit-option element specifies the the commit option from Section 10.5.9 and 12.1.9 of the EJB 2.0 specification

tag.name: @jrun.ejb-local-ref
tag.doc: The ejb-local-ref element describes a mapping between the ejb-ref-name that the bean developer provides and its JNDI name. The deployer provides the actual JNDI name

attribute.name: ejb-ref-name
attribute.doc: The ejb-ref-name element gives the name of an EJB from the ejb-jar.xml file. The bean developer this information

attribute.name: jndi-name
attribute.doc: The jndi-name element gives the JNDI name where the bean or resource will be bound

tag.name: @jrun.ejb-ref
tag.doc: The ejb-ref element describes a mapping between the ejb-ref-name that the bean developer provides and its JNDI name. The deployer provides the actual JNDI name

attribute.name: ejb-ref-name
attribute.doc: The ejb-ref-name element gives the name of an EJB from the ejb-jar.xml file. The bean developer this information

attribute.name: jndi-name
attribute.doc: The jndi-name element gives the JNDI name where the bean or resource will be bound

tag.name: @jrun.instance-pool
tag.doc: The instance-pool element contains the maximum and minimum size parameters for StatelessSessionBean instance pools

attribute.name: maximum-size
attribute.doc: The maximum-size element specifies the maximum size for StatelessSessionBean instance pools

attribute.name: minimum-size
attribute.doc: The minimum-size element specifies the minimum size for StatelessSessionBean instance pools

tag.name: @jrun.jdbc-mappings
tag.doc: The jdbc-mappings element holds information specific to JRun and not declared in the ejb-jar.xml file about the CMP mappings for an entity bean. jdbc-mappings are used to specify the SQL used to create, load, store, find and remove entity beans

attribute.name: create-table
attribute.doc: Whether JRun will attempt to create database tables

attribute.name: delete-table
attribute.doc: Whether JRun will attempt to delete database tables

tag.name: @jrun.jndi-name
tag.doc: The jndi-name element gives the JNDI name where the bean or resource will be bound

tag.name: @jrun.message-driven-destination
tag.doc: The message-driven-destination element provides the destination that the Message driven container uses

attribute.name: name
attribute.doc: The name element defines the parameter name

tag.name: @jrun.message-driven-subscription
tag.doc: The message-driven-destination element provides the destination that the Message driven container uses

attribute.name: client-id
attribute.doc: The client-id element provides client id for DurableSubscription setup and sign on

tag.name: @jrun.resource-env-ref
tag.doc: The resource-env-ref element describes a mapping between the resource-env-name that the bean developer provides and its JNDI name. The deployer provides the actual JNDI name

attribute.name: resource-env-ref-name
attribute.doc: The resource-env-ref-name element gives the name of a resource env from EJB view. The bean developer provides this information

attribute.name: jndi-name
attribute.doc: The jndi-name element gives the JNDI name where the bean or resource will be bound

attribute.name: mdb-destination
attribute.doc: The mdb-destination element specifies a message-driven bean destination

tag.name: @jrun.resource-ref
tag.doc: The resource-ref element describes a mapping between the resource name that the bean developer provides and its JNDI name. The deployer provides the actual JNDI name

attribute.name: resource-ref-name
attribute.doc: The res-ref-name element gives the name of a resource from EJB view. The bean developer provides this information

attribute.name: jndi-name
attribute.doc: The jndi-name element gives the JNDI name where the bean or resource will be bound

attribute.name: user
attribute.doc: The user element assigns a user identity to be used with a specified resource

attribute.name: password
attribute.doc: The password element provides user credentials to be used with user element to identify and authenticate a specified resource

tag.name: @jrun.timeout
tag.doc: The timeout element specifies the timeout value, in seconds, of a stateful session bean. The bean will be passivated if left idle for this duration

tag.name: @jrun.tx-domain
tag.doc: The tx-domain-name element gives the transaction domain name in which the bean's transactions will take place
